thread.title: SoftBank Drops on Decline in Alibaba Stake’s Market Value
thread.title_full: SoftBank Drops on Decline in Alibaba Stake’s Market Value - Bloomberg Business

author: Bloomberg.com
title: SoftBank Drops on Decline in Alibaba Stake’s Market Value
text:
SoftBank Group Corp. dropped to the lowest in two years as the market values of its biggest U.S. holdings, Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Sprint Corp., plunged.
Billionaire Masayoshi Son’s mobile carrier and Internet investment company fell as much as 6.9 percent to 5,835 yen, the lowest since July 2013. The slump came on the first Japanese trading day after the lockup on Alibaba shares was lifted one year after its initial public offering.
SoftBank has more than 1,000 investments, and its three biggest shareholdings of Alibaba, Sprint and Yahoo Japan Corp. have dropped by 700 billion yen ($5.8 billion) over the past 10 days to 8.7 trillion yen, according to its website . Japan’s third-largest wireless carrier also slumped with rivals on concerns that revenue may weaken after Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said the nation’s mobile-phone rates were too high.
“Mobile-phone companies are in a declining trend after Abe’s remarks,” said Tomoaki Kawasaki, an analyst at Iwai Cosmo Securities Co. in Tokyo. “SoftBank’s share price is also hurt by the end of the lockup on Alibaba shares.”
Alibaba fell for a fifth day Wednesday in New York, slumping to as low as $59.68, compared with its IPO price of $68.
